channel.title: information technology on Logotyp.us
channel.description: Recent content in information technology on Logotyp.us

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Avature Logo
Avature is a privately held global Human Capital Management software company which sells software as a service. The company was founded by Dimitri Boylan, co-founder and former CEO of HotJobs. It is incorporated in Dublin, Ireland, and has operating subsidiaries in Argentina, Australia, China, Germany, Spain, the United Kingdom and the United States. The Avature platform is designed to support HR teams with recruiting and talent management. It is used in 160 countries and 24 languages.
You can download theAvaturelogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Avature
item.description: Avature is a privately held global Human Capital Management software company which sells software as a service. The company was founded by Dimitri Boylan, co-founder and former CEO of HotJobs. It is incorporated in Dublin, Ireland, and has operating subsidiaries in Argentina, Australia, China, Germany, Spain, the United Kingdom and the United States. The Avature platform is designed to support HR teams with recruiting and talent management. It is used in 160 countries and 24 languages.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 Fiducia IT Logo
Fiducia IT AG was a German IT-service provider based in Karlsruhe. In 2015, it merged with the GAD eG to form Fiducia & GAD IT AG. Its core business was providing financial IT services for co-operative banks, with its customers also coming from the private banking sector, public institutions, and free enterprises. Fiducial’s integrated core banking system ‘agree’ was used by over 700 banks, supporting 97,000 workstations with 67 million accounts worldwide.
You can download theFiducialogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Fiducia
item.description: Fiducia IT AG was a German IT-service provider based in Karlsruhe. In 2015, it merged with the GAD eG to form Fiducia & GAD IT AG. Its core business was providing financial IT services for co-operative banks, with its customers also coming from the private banking sector, public institutions, and free enterprises. Fiducial’s integrated core banking system ‘agree’ was used by over 700 banks, supporting 97,000 workstations with 67 million accounts worldwide.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
451 Research Logo
451 Research is an information technology industry analyst firm, headquartered in New York with main offices in London, Boston, Washington DC, and San Francisco. The company claims over 250 employees, over 100 industry analysts and over 1000 clients. The company produces qualitative and quantitative research, across thirteen research channels, and targets service providers, technology vendors, enterprise IT leaders and financial professionals. In the Institute of Analyst Relations' survey of analyst relations professionals in 2017, 451 Research is listed as having the fourth highest relevance ratings, and the fifth highest impact ratings.
You can download the451 Researchlogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: 451 Research
item.description: 451 Research is an information technology industry analyst firm, headquartered in New York with main offices in London, Boston, Washington DC, and San Francisco. The company claims over 250 employees, over 100 industry analysts and over 1000 clients. The company produces qualitative and quantitative research, across thirteen research channels, and targets service providers, technology vendors, enterprise IT leaders and financial professionals. In the Institute of Analyst Relations' survey of analyst relations professionals in 2017, 451 Research is listed as having the fourth highest relevance ratings, and the fifth highest impact ratings.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Bechtle Logo
Bechtle AG is the largest IT system house in Germany with 70 locations in the D-A-CH region and trading companies in 14 European countries. The business model combines IT services with the direct sale of IT products. The focus is on trading in hardware and software as well as the operation and maintenance of IT infrastructure for industrial customers and public-sector clients. A survey conducted by German industry publications Computerwoche and ChannelPartner ranks Bechtle as the largest business-to-business IT service provider by revenue in Germany.
You can download theBechtlelogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Bechtle
item.description: Bechtle AG is the largest IT system house in Germany with 70 locations in the D-A-CH region and trading companies in 14 European countries. The business model combines IT services with the direct sale of IT products. The focus is on trading in hardware and software as well as the operation and maintenance of IT infrastructure for industrial customers and public-sector clients. A survey conducted by German industry publications Computerwoche and ChannelPartner ranks Bechtle as the largest business-to-business IT service provider by revenue in Germany.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 Birch Communications Logo
Birch Communications is an American provider of IP-based communications, network broadband, cloud computing, and information technology services to small, mid-sized, enterprise and wholesale business customers in the United States, Canada and Puerto Rico. Founded in 1996 in the wake of the 1996 Telecommunications Act, several years later the company began acquiring other telecom companies in an effort to increase its network size and service offerings. Birch Communications raised $77.5 million in funding in 2011, and $110 million in funding in 2012 after it financed a new $90 million facility.
You can download theBirchlogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Birch
item.description: Birch Communications is an American provider of IP-based communications, network broadband, cloud computing, and information technology services to small, mid-sized, enterprise and wholesale business customers in the United States, Canada and Puerto Rico. Founded in 1996 in the wake of the 1996 Telecommunications Act, several years later the company began acquiring other telecom companies in an effort to increase its network size and service offerings. Birch Communications raised $77.5 million in funding in 2011, and $110 million in funding in 2012 after it financed a new $90 million facility.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 Oki Electric Industry Logo
Oki Electric Industry Co., Ltd., commonly referred to as OKI, OKI Electric or the OKI Group, is a Japanese information and communications technology company, headquartered in Toranomon, Minato-ku, Tokyo and operating in over 120 countries around the world. OKI produced the first Japan-made telephone in 1881, and now specializes not only in developing and manufacturing telecommunications equipment but also in information products and mechatronics products, such as automated teller machine and printers.
You can download theOkilogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Oki
item.description: Oki Electric Industry Co., Ltd., commonly referred to as OKI, OKI Electric or the OKI Group, is a Japanese information and communications technology company, headquartered in Toranomon, Minato-ku, Tokyo and operating in over 120 countries around the world. OKI produced the first Japan-made telephone in 1881, and now specializes not only in developing and manufacturing telecommunications equipment but also in information products and mechatronics products, such as automated teller machine and printers.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Terremark Logo Terremark Worldwide, Inc., is of IBM, a provider of information technology services. Headquartered in Miami, Florida, the company had data centers in the United States, Europe and Latin America; it offered services which include managed hosting, colocation, disaster recovery, data storage, and cloud computing. Terremark employed over 750 people at its Miami-Dade County headquarters. Source
You can download theTerremarklogo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Terremark
item.description: Terremark Worldwide, Inc., is of IBM, a provider of information technology services. Headquartered in Miami, Florida, the company had data centers in the United States, Europe and Latin America; it offered services which include managed hosting, colocation, disaster recovery, data storage, and cloud computing. Terremark employed over 750 people at its Miami-Dade County headquarters. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 Aerohive Networks Logo
Aerohive Networks was an American multinational computer networking equipment company headquartered in Milpitas, California, with 17 additional offices worldwide. The company was founded in 2006 and provided wireless networking to medium-sized and larger businesses. In 2012, Aerohive was listed on The Wall Street Journal’s list of “Top 50 Start-Ups.” The company raised around $105 million in venture capital funding before undergoing an IPO in March 2014. On June 26, 2019, Extreme Networks announced its intent to acquire Aerohive for a purchase price of approximately $272 million.
You can download theAerohivelogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Aerohive
item.description: Aerohive Networks was an American multinational computer networking equipment company headquartered in Milpitas, California, with 17 additional offices worldwide. The company was founded in 2006 and provided wireless networking to medium-sized and larger businesses. In 2012, Aerohive was listed on The Wall Street Journal’s list of “Top 50 Start-Ups.” The company raised around $105 million in venture capital funding before undergoing an IPO in March 2014. On June 26, 2019, Extreme Networks announced its intent to acquire Aerohive for a purchase price of approximately $272 million.

Eizo Logo Eizo Corporation is a Japanese visual technology company, founded in March 1968, who manufacturers high-end display products and other solutions for markets such as business, healthcare, graphics, air traffic control, and maritime. The company is headquartered in Hakusan, Ishikawa Prefecture. Source
You can download theEizologo on full-version of the page. ]] >

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
OpenIO Logo
OpenIO was founded in 2015 by Laurent Denel, Jean-FranÃ§ois Smigielski, and five other co-founders, to offer an object storage solution for building hyper-scalable IT infrastructure for a wide range of applications. They have leveraged open source software, developed since 2006, based on a grid technology that enables dynamic behaviour and supports heterogenous hardware. In October 2017 OpenIO completed a $5 million funding round. In July 2020 OpenIO has been acquired by OVH.
You can download theOpenIOlogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: OpenIO
item.description: OpenIO was founded in 2015 by Laurent Denel, Jean-FranÃ§ois Smigielski, and five other co-founders, to offer an object storage solution for building hyper-scalable IT infrastructure for a wide range of applications. They have leveraged open source software, developed since 2006, based on a grid technology that enables dynamic behaviour and supports heterogenous hardware. In October 2017 OpenIO completed a $5 million funding round. In July 2020 OpenIO has been acquired by OVH.

Netcracker Technology Logo Netcracker Technology Corp., a wholly owned subsidiary of NEC Corporation, is a provider of business support system, operations support systems and software-defined networking and network functions virtualization solutions. The company also offers professional services, as well as managed services. Headquartered in Waltham, Massachusetts, Netcracker maintains operations and development facilities across the globe. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 Super Micro Computer Logo
Super Micro Computer, Inc, doing business as Supermicro, is an information technology company based in San Jose, California. Supermicro’s headquarters are located in Silicon Valley, with a manufacturing space in the Netherlands and a Science and Technology Park in Taiwan. Founded by Charles Liang, Wally Liaw and Sara Liu on November 1, 1993, Supermicro specializes in servers, storage, blades, rack solutions, networking devices, server management software and high-end workstations for data center, cloud computing, enterprise IT, big data, high-performance computing, and embedded markets.
You can download theSupermicrologo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Supermicro
item.description: Super Micro Computer, Inc, doing business as Supermicro, is an information technology company based in San Jose, California. Supermicro’s headquarters are located in Silicon Valley, with a manufacturing space in the Netherlands and a Science and Technology Park in Taiwan. Founded by Charles Liang, Wally Liaw and Sara Liu on November 1, 1993, Supermicro specializes in servers, storage, blades, rack solutions, networking devices, server management software and high-end workstations for data center, cloud computing, enterprise IT, big data, high-performance computing, and embedded markets.

CommVault Systems Logo Commvault is an American publicly traded data protection and data management software company headquartered in Tinton Falls, New Jersey. Commvault enterprise software can be used for data backup and recovery, cloud and infrastructure management, retention and compliance. Source
You can download theCommVaultlogo on full-version of the page. ]] >

The Weather Company Logo The Weather Company is a weather forecasting and information technology company that owns and operates weather.com and Weather Underground. The Weather Company has been a subsidiary of the Watson & Cloud Platform business unit of IBM since 2016. Source
You can download theThe Weather Companylogo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: The Weather Company
item.description: The Weather Company is a weather forecasting and information technology company that owns and operates weather.com and Weather Underground. The Weather Company has been a subsidiary of the Watson & Cloud Platform business unit of IBM since 2016. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 Yokogawa Electric Logo
Yokogawa Electric Corporation is a Japanese multinational electrical engineering and software company, with businesses based on its measurement, control, and information technologies. It has a global workforce of over 19,000 employees, 84 subsidiary and 3 affiliated companies operating in 55 countries. The company is listed on the Tokyo Stock Exchange and is a constituent of the Nikkei 225 stock index. Yokogawa pioneered the development of distributed control systems and introduced its Centum series DCS in 1975.
You can download theYokogawalogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Yokogawa
item.description: Yokogawa Electric Corporation is a Japanese multinational electrical engineering and software company, with businesses based on its measurement, control, and information technologies. It has a global workforce of over 19,000 employees, 84 subsidiary and 3 affiliated companies operating in 55 countries. The company is listed on the Tokyo Stock Exchange and is a constituent of the Nikkei 225 stock index. Yokogawa pioneered the development of distributed control systems and introduced its Centum series DCS in 1975.

<! [CDATA[
Maxar Technologies Logo Maxar Technologies is a space technology company headquartered in Westminster, Colorado, United States, specializing in manufacturing communication, Earth observation, radar, and on-orbit servicing satellites, satellite products, and related services. DigitalGlobe and MDA Holdings Company merged to become Maxar Technologies on October 5, 2017. Source
You can download theMaxarlogo on full-version of the page. ]] >

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 NCR Corporation Logo
NCR Corporation, previously known as National Cash Register, is an American software, managed and professional services, consulting and technology company. It manufactures self-service kiosks, point-of-sale terminals, automated teller machines, check processing systems, and barcode scanners. NCR was founded in Dayton, Ohio, in 1884 and acquired by AT&T in 1991. A restructuring of AT&T in 1996 led to NCR’s re-establishment on January 1, 1997, as a separate company and involved the spin-off of Lucent Technologies from AT&T.
You can download theNCRlogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: NCR
item.description: NCR Corporation, previously known as National Cash Register, is an American software, managed and professional services, consulting and technology company. It manufactures self-service kiosks, point-of-sale terminals, automated teller machines, check processing systems, and barcode scanners. NCR was founded in Dayton, Ohio, in 1884 and acquired by AT&T in 1991. A restructuring of AT&T in 1996 led to NCR’s re-establishment on January 1, 1997, as a separate company and involved the spin-off of Lucent Technologies from AT&T.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
NEC Logo
NEC Corporation is a Japanese multinational information technology and electronics corporation, headquartered in Minato, Tokyo. The company was known as the Nippon Electric Company, Limited, before rebranding in 1983 as NEC. It provides IT and network solutions, including cloud computing, AI, IoT platform, and telecommunications equipment and software, to business enterprises, communications services providers and to government agencies, and has also been the biggest PC vendor in Japan since the 1980s, when it launched the PC-8000 series.
You can download theNEClogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: NEC
item.description: NEC Corporation is a Japanese multinational information technology and electronics corporation, headquartered in Minato, Tokyo. The company was known as the Nippon Electric Company, Limited, before rebranding in 1983 as NEC. It provides IT and network solutions, including cloud computing, AI, IoT platform, and telecommunications equipment and software, to business enterprises, communications services providers and to government agencies, and has also been the biggest PC vendor in Japan since the 1980s, when it launched the PC-8000 series.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 Science Applications International Corporation Logo
Leidos, formerly known as Science Applications International Corporation, is an American defense, aviation, information technology, and biomedical research company headquartered in Reston, Virginia, that provides scientific, engineering, systems integration, and technical services. Leidos merged with Lockheed Martin’s IT sector in August 2016 for Information Systems & Global Solutions business to create the defense industry’s largest IT services provider. The Leidos-Lockheed Martin merger is one of the biggest transactions thus far in the consolidation of a defense sector.
You can download theLeidoslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Leidos
item.description: Leidos, formerly known as Science Applications International Corporation, is an American defense, aviation, information technology, and biomedical research company headquartered in Reston, Virginia, that provides scientific, engineering, systems integration, and technical services. Leidos merged with Lockheed Martin’s IT sector in August 2016 for Information Systems & Global Solutions business to create the defense industry’s largest IT services provider. The Leidos-Lockheed Martin merger is one of the biggest transactions thus far in the consolidation of a defense sector.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
trivago Logo Trivago N.V., marketed with lowercase styling as trivago, is a Dutch-domiciled transnational technology company specializing in internet-related services and products in the hotel, lodging and metasearch fields. The United States travel company Expedia Group owns a majority of the company’s stock. The company is incorporated in the Netherlands. Source
You can download thetrivagologo on full-version of the page. ]] >
